And it got even better - thanks ! BTW: No Titlebar == No Settings-Menu is no Bug. Just long click any app or shortcut in HBL,  then click on 'Settings' e voila: All Settings ... Just do not hide the Titlebar without adding/having at least one item to/in HBL  (aka Empty HBL).

title: Finally found the launcher I was looking for
comment: This was just the launcher I was looking for. One flaw with Android is that in order to open up a new app you have to return to the home screen. That's too many taps. Home Button Launcher (HBL) resolves this issue beautifully. And while other home button swipe-up launchers I checked out offer this feature, the UI  and screen customizations in HBL are just better: You can sort apps, control the size of app icons and text, create tabs, change the order of your tabs as well as swipe between them, which is a smart use of Android gestures.  I also checked out full-OS launchers like Action Launcher, but none of those let you launch an app while in another app like HBL does. The only bug I've come across is when you select "No title bar" under Settings; when you do that, the Settings button disappears along with the title bar and you can't back to it.
Works like a charm..

title: Favorite App Organizer
comment: Simply put... I have over 300 apps for learning, reading, browsing, bookmarking, and sharing all of the nerdy things that pique my interest. I have self diagnosed myself, in light of the aforementioned nerd confession, with an extreme case of Attention Deficit Disorder.                            Ever hit the home button to find where you saved an article on the desktop, and 30 minutes later, you are waste deep in the slums of Android, wondering WTF you were looking for? This app is the Adderall... If Google Play Store was a doctor. Makes hopping from one app or task to another, to share or save to another, etc. so effortless! I don't know how I ever accomplished anything of substance without it. Real talk. Try it!!!

title: Useful, well executed
comment: I've used any number of utilities like SwipePad, Pie Control, LMT Launcher, Swapps!, etc. Compared to these others, Home Button Launcher is by far the most useful and least intrusive, extending the utility of the Google Now swipe gesture. Well done!  One suggestion for the developer: If you moved the tabs from the top of the window to the bottom, they'd be easier to reach with a thumb for someone using the phone with one hand. Additionally, you'd prevent the tab bar target from shifting around (right now, i

title: Fast and simple app launcher
comment: This app is great at what it does, which is launch apps. It launches really fast and it is super easy to use and configure because there is no unnecessary options. This works great in combination with modified halo shortcuts apk and xhalofloatingwindow if you plan to use the app outside the home button (ex. Notification bar) . This also works great on phones with hardware keys if you are able to remap them, but it can also be used independently as well. I currently have it pinned in the notification bar.

comment: Should add swipe to change tabs. (You used my advice yay)  One problem, since it replaces the shortcut to Google now from the home button, it also replaces it from tapping the widget, not a big deal though just one extra click. (Fixed yay again) Absolutely love it! I love the fact that it's free and no ads! Whoever made this deserves an award! Love the tabs!! In my opinion, next step is widgets!! Widgets would be great I think, like the sound search one for quick access

title: Great
comment: Really cool! The option to change icons would be nice.

title: Great
comment: Super easy to use, kudos to the developers.

title: Definitely one of the best app
comment: Probably the best app I have ever downloaded.  It lets me organize a bunch of shortcuts in one place that is easily accessible.  Suggestions to improvements if possible would be the ability to set a "home" tab to start instead of starting the last tab opened.  Also the ability to have other launch options on the ring.  Like one at top, on the right and on the left.  That would vastly increase functionality.

title: EXCELLENT
comment: Thank goodness for apps like this one that lets you customise default buttons which normally would force you to Google apps. Runs really smoothly and is highly customisable.

title: Perfect for quick one hand launching
comment: Love it. Well done and smooth. Would love a better sorting method but otherwise great tool. Little bit laggy.

title: Awesome app for nexus 4!
comment: Feature Request: Is it possible to have multiple launch menus triggered by different gestures from the home button?   Ex.  Right now a single rocket icon appears off the home icon,  instead have multiple icons in the semi circle around the home button.  Also,  is it possible to disable it when the phone is locked?

title: Thank You
comment: A great big thank you to the developer for this perfectly functional app. This app saved me the cost of an upgrade to secure settings pro. With this app, I can launch any Tasker Task to replace the Google Now swipe up gesture. I am so happy that someone has chosen to make such an application freely available and ad free. If you want to do as I have done, just select auto launch from the settings and choose to delete all but the Tasker task you want to launch from the list.

title: Works great
comment: Great app. Does exactly what it says

title: Excellent!
comment: IT WAS EXCELLENT AND KEEPS GETTING BETTER! THANK YOU!! I wonder if we dispense with seeing the 'rocket', will it pop up even faster? Also I'd like to make two requests: option to temporarily disable HBL (gets in the way with certain games), and a kill current (foreground) task function to terminate non-responding apps. Thanks! Bump ^^

hi, for "temporarily disable" try this: increase 'number of tabs' by one, set 'auto start mode'=on.
on the last tab add "Home Launcher" through 'Add/Shortcuts' as the only item.
whenever that tab is selected, the app will not show on next swipe.
contact dev in case of issues: dynamicg.android@gmail.com

title: Deleted
comment: Used to love it because of the neat icon change for Google now. They changed to the standard icon so it is lame now.  Update: developers readded their own icon. I've reinstalled and am again happy with their app.
hi, just for info - the "rocket" launcher icon has been added again with version 2.1

title: Animation for swiping tabs
comment: That is the only feature missing. Very good app nonetheless.

title: A+
comment: I rarely give fives, nexus 4.

title: Slow
comment: It takes too long to open. About a 5 second delay. It has potential though.

title: Nice Start
comment: It is simple and does what it says, what would be excellent though is having multiple icons along the arc line rather than launching a separate list, would be much more flexible a 5 star app.

title: Doesn't work in Galaxy Note II
comment: Crashed the display. UI functions stopped. Home button won't work anymore nor the soft keys.
Can you retry with the latest version 2.5? There's a new option "HL/Samsung" which fixes the Samsung Galaxy issues.
Delivers what as promised

title: Very helpful
comment: and the fact that doesn't require any permission is simply awesome !!

title: good
comment: a very convenient free app for me

title: Perfect
comment: Enough said.

title: Awsome app!
comment: One of the best app shortcuts apps ever, and what's more, it's all free AND it has no ads at all! Love it!   :-P

title: Amazing app
comment: Absolutely fantastic. Would be even better if we could add contacts,swipe through panes and change icons. That would make the app perfect.

title: A Tier 1 Application
comment: There is nothing else. If you are looking for an app that let u launch app inside apps or other home launcher features. Look NO FURTHER!

title: Perfect
comment: Please add an activity launch option. Overall it is so perfect. :-)

title: Tabs option on the bottom
comment: Please add option to have tabs on the bottom.
Genius app

title: AWESOME
comment: this is the most awesomest coolest and illest app for jellybean phones that dont have a front button

title: Works excellent !
comment: Was looking for something to run a torch app from the lock screen, works as expected.
Extra click spoils the whole impression

title: Thanks for the inspiration!
comment: The app itself is nice and useful, but more than anything I like that it's inspired me with ideas on what I might be able to do with the ASSIST intent filter that could really make Jellybean friendlier for gamers.

title: Great!
comment: Would be perfect if there's an option to swipe to the side instead of up, so that it doesn't just replace Google Now but is something extra.

title: Great app
comment: This is great. The only thing I would prefer is a 'no labels' option on the pop-up.

title: Unnecessary extra click
comment: This app is probably going to save me a lot of time using my phone, but I wish I could get to the list of apps straight from holding down the home button. Like on the unlock screen on my Galaxy Nexus, there are multiple shortcuts right from holding the unlock button.  Wish there was an option for that. But still, very useful app.

title: Cannot open
comment: Every time I try to open it has me perform the action through Google now.

title: Awesome
comment: Would only like to see the ability to reorder apps after I've added them

title: Excellent
comment: Requires no permissions, open source, works perfectly. Install this app, it is very useful!

title: Awesome App!!
comment: Now this makes me feel, the swipe up option is the greatest thing ever on a android phone!!

title: Great app
comment: Gives you access to any app of your choice from anywhere on Android.  Another gem from dynamicG.

title: Blatant ripoff, but perfected
comment: Ripoff of sudo quicklaunch, but better (and free). Needs a higher Res icon. Otherwise its the best option out there for this particular function.
